resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
I am getting an error when building the image `ubuntu-docs`:

```
#5 43.03 The following packages have unmet dependencies:
#5 43.29  r-base : Depends: r-recommended (= 4.0.5-1.2004.0) but 4.1.0-1.2004.0 is to be installed
#5 43.33 E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
```

This was triggered when running `dev/release/post-09-docs.sh 4.0.1` on master.

comments.body: [~jorgecarleitao] - just wanted to double check if this is now resolved?  I was reading the dev mailing list and it looks like it might be?
Actually, had another look and looks like it was not.
